resources.string: Enable notifications to provide alert after 24 hours of inactivity?
Select EMG Bluetooth device from paired devices:

string.name: trenExpl
string.u: The Trendelenburg test is primarily used to determine and detect gluteus medius tendon tears or weakness in the hip abductors

resources.string: \u2022 The medically trained examiner, who assesses the pelvic location, stands behind the patient
\u2022 The patient is asked to stand on one foot and is then examined
\u2022 Normal! - Pelvis remains level: Torso does not lean towards the supported side of the body.
\u2022 Trendelenburg Sign! - Pelvis sags towards lifted leg. Patient will lose balance or try to maintain balance using a compensatory leaning of the torso towards the side of injury.\n
\u2022 Repeat and evaluate on the other leg \n
\t \u2022 Where the result is normal for both legs, proceed to next test
\t \u2022 Otherwise - The assessor will advise patient further

string.name: fmsSteps1
string.u: This test examines the range of motion and form of the patient performing a deep squat

resources.string: This is used to determine whether adjustments need to be made before use of equipment
\u2022 The patient is observed as a light pole is held overhead with arms fully stretched, about shoulder width apart
\u2022 The patient performs a squat and the performance is graded
\u2022 3 - Correct form observed, no compensations required
\u2022 2 - Correct form observed using a compensation e.g raising of calbes by 1-2"
\u2022 1 - Unable to perform movement even with compensations
\u2022 Score of 3 - Perform exercise as normal
\u2022 Score of 2 - Perform exercise with specified compensation
\u2022 Score below 2 - Assessor will advise patient further
Example of compensatory action - Alleviating forces on calf muscles
\u2022 Ensure the knee strap cables are connected as follows:
\u2022 Ensure the EMG coloured cables are connected as follows:
Apply the strap below the knee as shown below
Apply the strap above the knee as shown below
Note: The accelerometer must be facing forward as shown
\u2022 Remove excess hair from the desired region by clipping/shaving
\u2022 Thoroughly clean the skin to remove oil, make-up etc.
\u2022 This can be achieved using water and a clean towel
\u2022 Some individuals will require alcohol wipes to properly clean the skin
\u2022 Ensure the skin is thoroughly dry before the electrodes are placed
For accurate muscle activity detection, the electrodes must be placed as described in the next two slides
Note: The black wire should be placed on a separate section of the body, such as a bony location or non-adjacent muscle
Note: The red wire should be placed in the middle of the muscle body
Note: The blue wire should be placed towards the end of the muscle body
